description.narrative:
URDMC proposes to implement an integrated Emergency Food Security and Vulnerable Livelihood (EFSVL) intervention that is mindful ofboosting the capacity of selected households to have sustainable incomes in the short to medium term period. This integrated approach is important as food security and livelihood outcomes cannot be achieved without an enabling environment. The project target refugee community (70%) and the Host community (30%). The targeted community beneficiaries will be reached through the established structures in the settlements and at the sub-county levels such as the Refugee welfare councils and the sub county authorities respectively. In doing so, transparency and communication feedback mechanisms would have been improved between URDMC and the beneficiaries andthe different key stakeholders and thus improvement in accountability which of course will ultimately result into greater project acceptance and ownership among the beneficiary communities and the authorities under which the beneficiaries live.
The beneficiarieswill benefit from the planned trainings such as those in Group dynamics and financial literacy which are both aimed at equipping them with skills on how to manage their projects better and to ensure that they develop ownership of their own projects.
The bi-monthly project monitoring plans will also directly foster the aspects of ownership amongst the beneficiaries since they will have the platform to share with the monitoring team on some of the noted issues which may be like both enablers and blockers. The bi-monthly monitoring plans will also ensure sufficient participation of the beneficiaries in the project work especially during the entire project cycle.

participating-org.narrative: UGANDA REFUGEE & DISASTER MGT COU COUNCIL

Uganda Refugee and Disaster Management Council (URDMC) is a registered Ugandan-based Non-Governmental Organization registration No: S.5914/9502 with its Headquarter in Gulu and Field Office located on Gulu-Adjumani Road, adjacent to Pakele Police Post, Pakele Town Board. The organization was founded in 2012 with aims of protection of refugee#s rights through Food Distribution and Ware house management. URDMC partnered with MOBAN in collaboration with GIZ International in the implementation of Peace building project within Nakivale Refugees# Settlement-Western Uganda in 2012/2013. URDMC in close collaboration with OPM in South Western Uganda also contributed towards the emergency response for the Congolese Refugees in Matanda Transit Centre. In partnership with Apparel Art Uganda,URDMC is supporting child mothers in Northern Uganda with the aim of economically empowering them to exercise their rights and meettheir basic needs through creative arts and designs.
The Vision is: To be the leading organization in the protection of refugees#right and people affected by conflict and disaster# and the Mission is : #To promote and protect the rights of people who havebeen forced to flee their countries or their home regardless of their race, religion, nationality or political affiliations#.
The organisation has over three (3) years# experience in working with the people affected by disaster and conflict, especially the vulnerable children, youth and women to rebuild their lives and to promote peaceful co-existence and sustainable livelihoods in the community. URDMC believes that all people are equal and have the right to determine and direct their development, and to live in dignity regardless of background, status, and tribe, political and religious affiliation
